summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Senior Affairs Commission will hold a hybrid meeting on February 26, 2024, at 12:00 PM, both in-person at Dallas City Hall and via videoconference. The meeting aims to discuss various issues affecting senior services in Dallas, ensuring equitable access to resources and services for all residents.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the January 29, 2024 meeting.
2. Updates from Senior Affairs Commissioners on district initiatives.
3. Presentations from AIDS Services of Dallas regarding affordable housing for seniors and from the Dallas Housing Authority on housing programs for seniors.

**Important Details**:  
- The meeting will include reports on the Texas Open Meetings Act and updates on the Content Specialist Initiative.
- An update on the Development Code Amendment concerning Adult Day Cares and Child-Care Facilities will be provided.
- Briefings will cover housing and neighborhood revitalization efforts and updates on the Senior Services Program.

**Action Items**:  
The Commission will seek approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and may discuss potential policy changes related to housing programs for seniors. Decisions regarding the Development Code Amendment will also be addressed. Public speakers will have the opportunity to contribute, and registration is required 24 hours in advance.
